intro: Eriocaulon miquelianum f. involucratum, commonly known as the velvet sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage with a distinctive velvety texture on the leaves. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, preferring moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikelets, and it is often found in temperate regions. This fern-like plant plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and supporting local biodiversity.
